column4: regardless of which is "better" wicd is not the supported Ubuntu network program, and thus suggestions to replace with WICD should probably be kept to a minimum in this channel.
could you please stop telling everyone who asks a question to "man X" it's similar to RTFM
yeah, it's the "nice way" of saying that
you're thining of nvidia-xconfig i believe
but 2.6.33 isn't used by Lucid, just an FYI (at least not by default anyway)
that's why i said "most likely" supported, i don't know for sure
actually the failed to parse error isn't because of root
or much NICER, depending on the person using it
true - it's actually the only working version in Lucid right now, so it's what I'm using, but...
is that statement even true anymore?
i wouldn't have said it if it wasn't
do you get offended on a personal level when someone says "wtf" on the internet?

not really - BUT i do thing the no swearing and staying ontopic is very important if this channel is going to survive and thrive.  Keeping high standards towards support only is important - and the no swearing, including tla is something I think should not be tolerated at all.  yagoo/blakkeim i'm sorry if i upset either of you.
